intro: Erodium cicutarium f. subalbidum, commonly known as the white-stemmed bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Geraniaceae family. It is a low-growing annual herb characterized by its slender, often hairless stems and small, trifoliate leaves. The flowers are typically pink to white, with five petals, and appear in clusters at the leaf axils. This subspecies is native to regions of Europe and is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in cultivated areas. It has a short life cycle and is adapted to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
